7s6RHVCyzVdzhSbxubP2xA.text: Very nice sea food restaurant. Great selection of oysters and really good native lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Jersey och Lindisfarne ostron

b7pgH1Wrfl4V8neVMJO1rw.text: Very pricey restaurant (oyster bar) located in Soho area. I went in for their after-hours special. 1 pound for 1 oyster. When I told them I wanted the special and wanted different osyters, they said its' only one type of oysters for the special. So i ordered 10 and it was fresh and delicious. I think the waiter was kind of looking at me cheap as that's all i ordered. But when I gave him a big tipe, he was all smiles and helpful with my questions about the area and where to shop. I don't blame him. I would not come back here as the prices are just too much.

WPTFMAthpCLQn7XzkJHHbw.text: Been to the borough one too and I think both locations have their own qualities.  Slightly more spacious in soho and more of a restaurant feel in comparison to the cosy and busy bar atmosphere at Borough.  I like both equally.Duchy natives rule... I could eat them all day.  Rockerfellas, on this occasion, did not meet the standards of Borough, still good though.  Steak tartare was phenomenal. If you love oysters and shell food, what's there not to like about wright bros? great fishy protein hit! YUM

tcrFPbbRXQ-hfJ6ML6Mrog.text: Lovely food, I love love love seafood, full house plater is great, service can be improved.

-ZLVaLxBatRH3O2UfINx4w.text: A superb restaurant in the heart of Soho, just off Regent St., with a stylish decor, very warm, cosy and chariasatic, lovely ambiance. Charming waiters, great advice in terms of food. The service was excellent and fast. I had a glass of white wine, Mâcon Solutré. Fruity sweet flavoured wine, definitely goes great with the fish. In term of oysters, I had Spécial de Claire and Brownsea Island. They were both great, but from these two I would suggest the Spécial de Claire with lemon on top. As house staples, my friend and I tried Smoked mackerel pâté and Cornish crab. They were both great. I would suggest the Cornish crab as it's more subtle. From the specials main, I had the Whole Grilled Plaice pancetta, sage and capers. It was amazing. Tender taste with amazing flavour. Great!My friend had Red wine braised cuttlefish with scallops and White beans. It was tasty and filling. For desert we had chocolate pot & hazelnuts, and a caramel cream. I definitely suggest the caramel cream. The bill was £91 without service. A great evening and great company.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

BrQmwW_k00bqVEqvkvGOkw.text: I'm not a huge oyster fan, but their oysters were very good and fresh.  Their fish was so fresh.  My husband had the sea bass and I had the Dorset cod.  Everything was so fresh and cooked perfectly.  The kids loved their kid's fish and chips.  Worth the long wait!

fGaWgbXW2cTaBm-tUFbjdg.text: 5 different types of Oysters well prepared--heaven.  This space is really great--3 levels with lots of different setups--counter space, counter space in front of the kitchen staff, tables, and communal tables.  There is also a courtyard that I will be frequenting during the summer.  It is nicely decorated and we just adored the space. We enjoyed Oysters, Atlantic shrimp, crab on toast and smoked mackerel pate.  The only issue I have here is if you want to have "hot" food most of the dishes were prepared "for two". The portions such as the mackerel pate were quite large.  Also much of the fish is prepared whole. So it is hard to figure out a strategy for ordering.  And if you don't like fish and seafood do not bother--I don't think there was a non-seafood offer except the side green salad, potato and veg of the day!The service could have been better .  We were at the counter and felt a bit neglected.  However, if you like Oysters, a place not to be missed.

9lTMchG6NvIoP4teNskOeA.text: Accessible from both Kingly Court and Kingly Street with outdoor, ground floor and basement seating and a casual but elegant vibe, Wright Brothers' new restaurant is a welcome addition to the already burgeoning Soho dining scene. It's nice to see these Borough Market darlings branch out across the Thames too. Service during my lunchtime visit at the bar was efficient and a lot friendlier than I've come to expect at most London eateries. When you go, if they've got Kumamoto oysters order them! Id never had these slightly sweet and delicately flavourful morsels before, but after trying a lovely starter course of them here, I'd definitely be up for slurping 'em down again  and soon. I also really enjoyed my main course of chalkboard special Cornish squid with butter beans, chorizo and aioli (£11) either. However, with options including whole Dorset crab (£12.50), ox cheek, ale and oyster pie (£16.50) and an enticing range of oysters, it might be awhile before resorting to those initial options.

Xf3p3dPxysuY3RjTzn0D_g.text: The seafood in Wright Brothers is one of the best in London, I shall say. There are quite many options for oysters, usually at least six, from both the UK and other parts of Europe. I prefer the Scottish ones because they are bigger and creamier.  The mussels are very tender and nicely cooked in the white wine source. They are delicious. The fish, I shall say, is done brilliantly. The only thing I hope they can improve is that there's little choice on vegetables that go with the seafood. Quite monotonous. Apart from that, Wright Brother is really worth visiting.

slyXLFFc625WOprNuD_9zg.text: For photos see Greedy Diva @ greedydiva.blogspot.com/…  The new Wright Brothers Soho is certainly a fun place to gather the troops, or dine solo, for seafood binges large and small. Our Sunday night party of 6 gathered in the downstairs bar to share some champagne and oysters. I love the fit out of the bar area - high table seating, white tiles and exposed brickwork, industrial fittings, high ceilings and an open kitchen set the scene for a potentially buzzing area once the crowds start flocking in. It would also be the perfect place to eat alone at the bar while watching your oysters being shucked. Most of the searfood is sourced from Small Cornish day boats and is fresh and from sustainable stocks. The shellfish hails from Wright Brothers' own Duchy Oyster Farm on the Helford River in Cornwall, or other parts of Britain and France. Mmm... oysters - the ultimate creamy, salty taste of luxury. We ordered 2 dozen - a mixture of everything including the special Japanese Kumamotos, Carlingfords, Duchy Natives, Colchesters, Speciales de Claire and Maldons. All were good, but I particularly liked the buttery Carlingfords and the small, briny Kumamotos. Deep-fried whitebait with tartare sauce were slightly overseasoned but the delicate, crisp batter gave way to fresh, steamy moist flesh. Tiny Falmouth Bay prawns in garlic and butter are sweetly addictive and a large slab of toast lathered in a generous serving of fresh crab was also lovely and big in flavour. Service was friendly but a little slow - I had the feeling they didn't want to disturb our conversation which meant we found it difficult to get the food coming. But, it's still early days. Prices range from around £6-7 pounds for 3 oysters and the small tasting plates are generally around £4-9 each. Larger dishes like fish pie (£14.50) and ox cheek, ale and oyster pie (£18.50) are there for more substantive bites. I say it's very reasonably priced. The dessert menu is also appealing (including lemon sorbet from Gelupo, chocolate pot and hazlenuts or Neals Yard cheese). However, we outstayed the bar's shorter opening hours on Sunday (I think it closed at about 11pm), so we hit Bar Italia (it's been years, YEARS!) for panettone and fab hot chocolates. The upstairs restaurant at Wright Brothers Soho is also gorgeous - a slightly more romantic setting with candlelight and large windows overlooking Kingly Street. I already liked the original Borough branch, and now the Soho venue is a place to which I'll definitely be returning on a regular basis - for a more substantial meal next time, and then again when the need for reasonably priced oysters and bubbly after a hard days shopping takes hold.

SCa1s50HkzgxGH-S7NMLtQ.text: If you're a fan of shellfish then you found your heaven. Started the night with two orders of 12 rock oysters and two glasses of champagne. Oysters= yummy! Moved on to a large order of mussels and = yummy. Got the check and asked the waitress what was that snail looking thing on that persons plate and she went and got some for me to try. Whelks and winkles are delicious.  Thank you for expanding my palate wright brothers and thank you for having fresh and delicious food.

xSYdGXwMQ9uFj0xRqID4yw.text: I tried their oysters and the fish soup for lunch. The oysters were pretty good but the fish soup was quite exceptional. I would love to try the artichoke vinaigrette on their special menu next time!

lTMFZOmwjzslVJpey08Pdw.text: Last Saturday night saw us seeking a tasty supper in Soho after a late afternoon braving the madness of Oxford Street and Selfridges department store in particular (note to self: never again venture into Oxford Street other than at 10am on a mid-week morning). As big fans of the Borough Market branch of the growing Wright Brothers empire this new central London restaurant had been on our must visit list for a while and the prospect of a plate of creamy, salty oysters soon raised our flagging spirits. The Soho branch is very much the grown up big brother to the much smaller and intimate original venture in Borough. There are two large more formal dining rooms on the ground floor with a more casual bar and dining area in the basement which has a fine view of the bustling open kitchen. My choice would be for the basement area where you will be sitting on stools at the high, long tables right at the heart of the action. Despite the pretty steep prices this is not stuffy fine dining; the staff are friendly, the specials of the day are chalked up on a blackboard and the vibe is what you would expect from an industrial type space in the heart of Soho. No trip to Wrights would be complete without some oysters and we ordered 3 speciales de claires and 3 oysters dressed with apple, shallot and cider vinegar. Beautifully presented they all slipped down a treat  a great way to start any meal. We teamed the oysters up with a 460ml flask of a very nice Albarino Igrexario  a lot of the wines on the wine list are available as 460ml flasks which is helpful if you don't want to break the bank (the bog standard, very ordinary house white is £22 a bottle). Despite being a Saturday night we were under no pressure to move the meal along quickly so we waited until after our oysters to decide on our mains. A good idea as the oysters had perked up our appetites and we decided to share a starter portion of delicious moules mariniere before moving onto the plaice with pancetta, sage and capers for me and the pork belly with clams and salsa verde for B. Sides are not included with main dishes so we added on a portion of firm, creamy new potatoes which we shared. Given the growing tendency of many restaurants to charge for bread it's worth noting that at Wrights you will be provided with an excellent selection of two or three types of loaf and a generous portion of lovely butter. Bread and butter will be replenished upon request  essential if you want to enjoy every last bit of the sauce with your moules mariniere! Desserts never seem quite the thing at Wrights and this visit was no exception. The bill was by no means a bargain but seemed a far price to pay for this quality of food in central London. The Borough branch remains my favourite but I have no doubt that we will be dropping in again before too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

XaiOWRCnYYIbMR8ceLvk8g.text: We came here for a pre-theatre meal. We ordered the special of the day which was a glass of wine, mussels with sauce of the day, and fruit and cream dessert, all for 20 GBP. It was fabulous and fresh. Mussels that day was in a Thai curry sauce. We saw others with seafood platters but those are a bit pricier. Our kids liked it too. Wait staff was friendly. We would definitely come back.

pipomwYmNKvhb28j_7cjKg.text: Decent food..service needs to be worked on..maybe it's the service I'm used to in the states and the Far East..but basically some of the staff need more training on efficiency..it makes a difference

f1GjVzJudf79EFuLCNqoRQ.text: very nice oyster especially cumbrae from scotland. 33gbp is a valuable price. We can test 6 kind of oysters once. That's great. And everybody should try beef kikita as well. A kind of beef with blood, but it's fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. lovly oysters especilly cumbrae from scotland

lGBs5fjJ6YQBR-JRYxzzcg.text: You got to have the oyster shot!  The oysters are excellent and the special oyster (I don't remember the name of the ones I ordered) very good. Mine had fresh grated Wasabi, quite fiery but truely excellent.  The restaurant while separated into smaller room is a bit big compared the the other Wright and looses a bit of the vibrancy due to that.  Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Oyster shot!
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Oyster with Wasabi

mNQ4qO16CAzZeaK0YnSXjg.text: Easy to find in a very busy Soho, with two entrances from either side. There are signs of happy hour £1 oysters but the menu prices for dinner are far from that value. We went for a platter as there were 5 of us eating. We worked our way through prawns, razor clams, mussels, winkles, oysters (of course). The platter itself was good, but with the flavours reliant on the sauces we had to also order a lobster salad. The lobster salad intrigued us with its pairing with papaya and foie gras. The flavour was quite a disappointment - far too sweet and not complimenting the lobster flesh whatsoever. The papaya was more like green mango and there were seeds randomly added in - it did not work.The main I ordered the roast cod - it came with samphires, mushrooms and truffle oil. The sauce was creamy and rich and the flakiness of the cod was lost in this sauce. The wine was good - Australian pinot noir, but I wanted more flavour from the dishes cooked rather than remembering the wine.I will be back...for the £1 oysters and maybe the platter. Join me for a happy hour of oysters? ;)

kJXPI0PpJzGzQPWiqaqzhw.text: Friendly staff and great selection of seafood. Food was a little on the inconsistent side. Had dinner here twice and the mussels the first time were perfect but overlooked the second time.   The main courses were always fantastic except for when the waitress accidentally flung a fish head at my colleague accidentally when attempting to fillet his dinner. We would both go back though. Just make sure you have a catchers mitt with you.

2kga0WuuVeEHsHEQ_cvMtg.text: Really good seafood platters! The Cumbrae oysters were amazing. On happy hour in the afternoon they are 1£ each, perfect shopping break. Also the service was great. I can really recommend this restaurant if you like seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

nTJTRETb1F-u9WnNujIvlA.text: The seafood platter was terrific and had we stopped there, I would have given a solid 4 stars but unfortunately for us we also ordered other items on their menu.  The tuna sashimi, salmon sashimi, and lobster salad came with a very sweet dressing.  So sweet, it completely bludgeoned the delicate flavours of the seafood components.  I really wish we just continued with a second platter of fresh seafood.  More often than not less is more and simple, fresh flavours are the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. The house platter with a lobster salad on the left

OeDNazYQuOS_M2z1wwAWKA.text: oyster selection is a must try, natural is perfect, not a fan of dressing.soft shell crab is great!great service, probably one of the best oyster bars in london.

suxlnovLS8dkvzfdbkxi4g.text: Started with the oyster selection and was in heaven. Love that they have mini signs in front of the oysters so that you knew what you were going to eat. The staff were very good at helping with selections. I had the soft shell crab for my main and it was perfect. Added a goats cheese salad which was out of this world (amazing dressing and cool 'greens'). Will go back for another date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Oysters

z2ULBEm16jHnxY6Hq9xJvw.text: We had walked in the area a while ago but didn't have the time to stop for some oysters. But this time we decided to stop by. And this was an excellent decision. The place itself is very cosy and friendly, hidden in a small court next to Carnaby street. There's two main areas, next to the small court with high tables and on the street side with regular table. And a huge terrace outside. Pick your preferred one. We loved staying on the high tables. As for food: I'd just go for the oysters. Lots of choices, delicious and fresh. They even have their own production which we found very nice also. Of course we tried other items of the menu, one or two were average (the ceviche) of hers were excellent (the king crab, the salmon, etc. )All this combined with a good choice of drink. Service is also friendly and efficient. So all in all a great place to go for seafood in London :-)

swLtCOpYxIMXdNuXcNat9g.text: On my quest to find the best oysters in London I had to visit Wright Brothers. I got there around opening time so there was not an electric feeling to the place, other than their funky light bulbs. That said, I was greeted promptly and educated on the differences of their oyster offerings. They were all great but I think the best thing about this place was that they turned me on to using the green Tabasco sauce to spice up my oysters. Now I probably live a 4 hour drive from where they make that stuff and I had to come to London to learn about it. But thank god I did. Me and the wife are thinking of packing a bottle in her purse every time we go out to a local place at home in Texas. A little lemon and green Tabasco will top horseradish and cocktail sauce any day. Their presentation here is also very thoughtful. Each type of oyster we ordered was marked with its name on a oyster shell tucked above it. Like true tourists, we nabbed them all and took them home so we can frame them in a shadow box as an ode to our love of oysters. Scuse' the pun, but Wright Brothers is flying high in our book. Would definitely visit again on our next trip across the pond.

zu0_BNT5RnoPkQ_y81dkJg.text: FRESH SEAFOOD!! Their seafood are fresh and delicious. The customer services were amazing. The place is very small but nice. I ordered many different raw oysters, mussels, clams and also steamed mussels and they were all very fresh. Seafood lovers MUST GO!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. steamed mussels
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

UnDBXD7nsJI8fyd7qIc65g.text: the seafood is generally really good. but it doesn't have many baked oysters. however, the mains are great and the dessert is amazing thanks to the staff recommendation.

qyMsfVVipsAJFjmdNkH2Jg.text: Go during happy hour. £1 an oyster. That's a great deal. Had a fair few with some good stout which the barman advised would go well with the oysters (and they certainly did). Has an absolutely stunning interior too. You wouldn't think that when you are coming from a modest outside of the place.

wyNcSSgHTCDm2MPlNbHTZg.text: I've only gone in for the oyster happy hour (m-f, 3-6) and it's one of the best deals in London. The oysters are high quality, the space is beautiful and the staff have always been very friendly. Add on a few glasses of prosecco and I think it's the perfect Happy Hour spot.

TXUqI-J3eKWGHpdTD2wwCA.text: A great seafood place in the heart of Soho. We booked a table for lunch and we arrived to a friendly hostess that promptly seated up. We decided to get half a dozen special Dutch oysters,  some cucumber oysters and wasabi oysters. My wife and I have an annual ritual of going to our favorite oyster bar in Paris every time we travel to Paris, so you can say we are big oyster fans. We found the Dutch oysters to be ok, in comparsion with the French. However what surprised us were the wasabi flavored oysters. Interesting and quite tasty. While we prefer the old school way of eating, it was refreshing to try something new. We ordered some mussels and snails, which wasnt bad but we still prefer the French way of cooking. We ordered a fish for the main dish and decided to share. The outside was done nicely, however once we de-boned it ourselves, we found the center to be completely undercooked. We brought this to the restaurant staff and she was quicked to handle it. About 10~15 minutes later, a new fish was brought out and it was done perfectly. Great attentive service and quick to take care of the issue. The seafood was good and I would consider going back when Im in the area.

KqvUOvjsRKHW9ybUyjPMYw.text: Having walked past this new place via Kingly Street it stood out straight away as an attractive venture. I was hesitant to try before having read some reviews as I hate nothing more than wasting money on bad food. After having read my first good review and understanding a bit more about the company's heritage I suggested it as a pre christmas dinner venue, something lighter to start off the season of over eating.Could't have been happier, the freshest fish and seafood and great service. Prices were reasonable for Soho and seafood.We had a variety of dishes not all I can remember as it was a while ago but we particularly enjoyed the Mussels and Spanish Fish Stew.I often reccomend this place for good food, with resonable prices and great service...

sGMnpuanEKVzlxT6C1wKRg.text: Ok, if I fancy oysters I shall go here - that's my resolution. First time ever I was asked which type of oysters I like. My answer was genuine - 'I didn't know there is many!' I then asked the waiter to talk me through the different types. The waiter explained them and we definitely selected a good one! I recommend going for a dozen and choose a few types on one platter so that you can taste the difference.I like the bar area a lot, as also - if you sit there fast service is guaranteed. We sat at the area upstairs so the service was slower which would've been unfortunate, but fortunately we weren't in a rush!My dad and I ordered a sea bass to share - don't be fooled - the seabass portion served there is huge! Definitely a main course for two! And it also very simply cooked - lemon and rosemary, so the main thing you taste - is really just fresh fish!

8HCFjP_VeH3O1G1ZabS5jg.text: So great oyster :) so nice food place! The Chinese door man is nice & handsome, seafood is fresh, the drink is so delicious, nice place, and will go to definitely next time! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

27jO8vCr2D-uQDi7BLh0Xg.text: London isn't blessed with a ton of great seafood restaurants, but Wright Brothers is clearly one of them. We started with the oysters and chili prawns. I'm not an oyster expert, so all I can tell you is that they were from France and were very flavorful, I'd get them again. For the main, I had the whole sea bass and my wife had the cod, both were picked clean. To top it off, they have a great beer and wine selection. Service was friendly and attentive without lording over us and the restaurant has great ambience.It isn't cheap, but fairly standard for this level of food in London. We will definitely be back.

-UujMZ0f9cA112NHdrp6yw.text: Haaaaaa seafood!!! I love it!! (I knew why I was going there!!) I booked online which was very easy. When We got there, we were quickly seated and cared for. We started with some easy cocktails which were delicious and then shared a seafood platter. Num num num. Fresh and delicious food. I have been to several Wrights Brothers restaurants and they are always great! A very safe bet if you want some seafood!

1Vgr1Nbm1hTbAKBrJHiFVQ.text: We were walking along Carnaby street when my friend was craving oysters. We decided to come to Wright Brothers  which is located on the ground floor of Kingly Court and has outdoor seating.We got a half dozen variety with some prawn cocktails. All the oysters and prawns were fresh and yummy! We also got the tuna ceviche to follow. This was good too but not the best I've had. We also ordered some hot food to share - soft shell crab and fries. After trying everything, I can say the oysters and prawn cocktails were the winners. I highly recommend trying the raw seafood here. We also found out that they do £1 oysters for happy hour every day from 3-6PM so I'll definitely be back for happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Side of fries
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Half dozen oysters and prawn cocktails
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Soft shell crab

XhaAbx2PoIZhOjn0OUy0kQ.text: The Good: I liked the location; the place was night; oyster menu and variety; service.The Bad: the Mussels; I had them and didn't like them; this may be my personal preference but they were very large, under cooked, and the sauce was bland. The Rest: dinned with my 23 year old daughter; she had the crab and loved it; said it was one of her favorite places we ate (second to a top Indian restaurant) while we were in London. I thought the Cabernet selection was slim. I really enjoyed the oysters. The service was great. Overall I would say above average but not spectacular.

DoHmgXAtsomceHapBYFr9Q.text: Came here for dinner on my recent trip to London. It was one of the highlighted meals of this trip. Remember when I went to Paris several years ago after graduate school, I didn't spurge on the seafood plater deluxe that time. So I didn't ended up trying the French crab (aka brown crab). With much regrets I was determined to get this brown crab baby into our stomach this time around. There are a few Wright brothers in London, not every location offers this plater. For instance, the one at the borough market doesn't. Tip* you have to make a reservation and leave a phone number so they can call you. If you are like me... didn't have a local phone that they can reach you, leave the number of your hotel, or promise to show up on time and actually show up on time. I wanted to thank the manager - Danny. He was very nice and helpful to us. Without this help we won't be able to get a table for two on Saturday night-- booking the night before. Thank you! We came here for the seafood -- the seafood deluxe was our target. Everything was soooo yummy. The tiny snails, tiny sweet shrimps that you don't have to peel, oysters, clams, mussels, LANGOUSTINE, and THE BROWN CRAB. It was messy to eat it but it was so worth it. First of all for the price -- it was a no brainer. I've never seen a seafood plater this affordable in NYC. I am sure you can get this if you are willing to pay a lot for it. Boy, I can eat the crab all by myself and die happy. Too bad I can't eat another one because I would if I could put down more food. We also ordered a bunch of other stuff. They were good but since I was so full after the seafood plater, they weren't as memorable to me. I think we got sushi/sashimi with ponzu, grilled Argentinian prawns, and beet root salad. If I were to stay for one more day, I would go back again for the crab. The one star was taken out because our waitress was not attentive. We had to flag her down and waited for her for a long time to fill our water glasses.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. I came here for this! Must get because even New York doesn't have this. Believe it or not!!
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Menu

pjGvi1s-N2wbQhVgs1ECvA.text: Nice selection of fresh oysters, though they were not properly shucked, had to work at each of them to separate  from shells.Grilled prawns were pointless; impossible to separate meat from shell and unpleasant to eat with shell on.Squid tempura was tasty though a bit too oily, and very plainly plated just a few strips of squid on a bare plate.In the end we both felt we'd made a poor choice for dinner and would not return.

dFZNbFDVpGX0Zt5cKtafGw.text: Their shell fish and oyster are fresh and tasty, but the cot fillet is terribly terrible bitter, dry and ruined the whole evening. And the waitress was very kind and thoughtful, but the waiter( or manager,IDK) not very friendly, not saying he is rude, but kind of make people feel not being taking care of, you know what mean, like a ruthless boyfriend you once had.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

5BeGUbU2ZP82r9nSeyEIjQ.text: Located in a food court style location with shared space for outdoor seating with other establishments. Nothing very remarkable about the wine. You go in and order and pay for your drink of choice, like many places in London, so don't sit around waiting for a server. Belly up to the bar and place your order.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Courtyard
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Entry
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Courtyard

tkj2khavviWVtYbsviz-SQ.text: Cute restaurant, wanted to sit outside but it was for cocktails only. Good food, had the steak and prawns meal. The green beans were really tasty. Not a fan of the minted potatoes but not a huge fan of mint food in general. Friendly service and stylish atmosphere.

2RHDc2SQPKUUXJlfO-PYjQ.text: It's in soho London and I had my stop for some oysters- I don't want to say it's not good but not as great as the oysters I had in states. For some reason, most seafood in U.K. were pretty fishy. They are famous in their oysters and I did enjoy mine. The service was really nice even tho I only had oysters and a glass of wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

oTXK36uMujhRcZRPXPPeRg.text: With all the people in the courtyard and the restaurant, it's gotta be great, right?!  Disappointment at best, unfortunately.  Was not able to reserve a table online but showed up and walked right in.  Ordered a table full of the signature dishes and proceeded to completely shattered the "never a bad meal in London" streak.  The house seafood platter was filled with fresh, yet tasteless crustaceans.  The sauces were bland and tasted off the shelf.   Large langoustines were high in quality but lacked any taste.  Mussels were mediocre and the octopus was chewy and also bland. When the best parts of the meal were the beer, the grilled asparagus, and the fries (which were excellent by the way), there are probably room for improvement.  Service was rushed and mediocre like the food.  Just goes to show, not every restaurant is up to par in SOHO regardless of appearances.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

TxqRc7kY5rlXsyRNjLbEsg.text: Tip: Go during Oyster Happy Hour, when select oysters are £1. Got 2 dozen Lindisfarne, which were some of the best I have ever had. They are quite meaty and not too brine-y, which is just the way I like them. They are served with small diced onions in vinegar and lemon wedges as well as Tabasco sauce. We also got a House Platter, which we asked for without oysters, so it came with whelks, mussels, clams, and shell-on prawns. The clams were too salty for my taste, but the the rest of the selection was amazing. The platter was served with some mayo-based sauce and a lemon wedge. As recommended by our waiter, we also got a few small plates to share to complement our raw bar selection. The yellowfin tuna takaki was too thinly sliced for my taste, and the tempura fried rye bay squid was a bit doughy although very well fried. Service was great, especially since we went early and were situated conveniently by their convergence point.While the meal did make a non-trivial hole in the wallet, I thought it was reasonable given the location and quality of food. Will definitely return once my bank account recovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. 2 dozen Lindisfarne oysters
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. tempura fried rye bay squid
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. yellowfin tuna tataki

5RdSD-LRnQm_u0AihRUVhA.text: My friend Laura and I regularly meet up for something to eat. This time it was the turn of Wright Brothers in Soho to feed us before we headed off to Trafalgar Studios to see The Grinning Man.Wright Brothers is a small London chain of seafood restaurants with 5 locations around the city; Soho, Borough Market, Spitalfields, Battersea and South Kensington. We went to the Soho branch as it was closest to the theatre. It's located on Kingly Street which runs adjacent to Carnaby Street and even has an entrance there too. A fantastic location, I think you would agree.We usually go to places that have great meat or high end dining restaurants but Laura fancied a change and requested "fish" instead so after a bit of research we chose Wright Brothers. I had a look at the menu before booking and they had a broad selection of dishes to choose from. I also noticed that they offered seafood platters. I'd never had one before and I've wanted one for a long time so that's what we went for!I arrived a little before Laura and was shown to a rather small table next to the Kingly Street entrance (which became an issue later!) by a very friendly and chatty server. I take the liberty of ordering a cocktail for Laura and I and decide on a fresh number called a Jasmine Bloom. It contained gin, jasmine syrup, cucumber and soda and was a perfect start to the evening.As I had mentioned, there was only one thing on the menu I wanted to order. Luckily, Laura was more than happy to go along with it. We got the Full House platter which our server assured us was enough for 2 people. Laura ordered some broccoli tempura to accompany the platter. I'll be honest, I ate most of the tempura - it was delicious but the batter was a bit on the thick side.I ordered some wine to go with the food. They had plenty to go for but as we were eating shellfish I went for a white. I chose a Riesling as I wanted something nice and dry with light fruitiness to compliment the shellfish. This one was a winner. Made by Ernst Loosen at Villa Wolf in the Pfalz region of Germany. I highly recommend this combination. Wright Brothers sell this by the glass, 500ml or full 750ml bottle.We saw the seafood platter approaching from across the room. It was huge! This was going to be a problem. Did I mention that the table was rather small? The server put a trivet on the table to raise the platter about 6-9 inches off the table. This only helped so much as we already had a plate each, a basket of bread, glasses for water, cocktails and wine, the broccoli tempura and bowls for the empty shells. The table got VERY crowded, very quickly.The seafood platter itself was epic. Here's a list of what was on it.OystersRazer clamsShell on prawnsMusselsLangoustineClamsWhelksA whole crabShrimpI can confirm that it was all absolutely stunningly delicious (except for the whelks; we were not a fan because they're quite strong in flavour and chewy). The seafood platter was served, as is traditional, cold over ice with aioli and a shallot vinaigrette. I'd never tried oysters before this and I was pleasantly surprised. They weren't as slimy as I'd been told they would be. They were as salty, but that's what Tabasco and shallot vinaigrette is for! I will say that my favourites on the platter were the shell on prawns and the crab which were incredibly succulent and moreish. We left q fair few of the shrimps because they were really small and fiddly to de-shell.That was a lot of food for 2 people and we did our best. We were, however, defeated in the end.We'll be returning to Wright Brothers at some point. I might take my wife as she would definitely find something to eat on the menu even with her discerning taste. We probably wouldn't have the seafood platter again as it was A LOT of food. I felt that even though we ate a lot, we also wasted a fair amount which we ended up paying for.

xSQ1IMybovRwopQDO8k-Tg.text: Great location with food that was very good but the service was awful.  It took about 45 minutes to get one of our entrees (the other was served right away and we didn't see the server in the meantime).  Oysters are 1 pound each from 12-6p at this location.  That's a great deal and I went through 18 for my lunch.  There are daily lunch specials that are very fairly priced as well.

daTmV3RJfgIU2ryl8bXbfQ.text: Went for lunch, and had a good experience overall. We had oysters for starter, then I had a king prawn for my main. The oysters were fresh, though slightly overpriced. After the meal, we were told that they do oyster happy hours 3-5pm every day for £1 per oyster, so try to aim for that. My king prawn was good, though also overpriced for the quantity, I would say. Service was generally good and prompt. We sat outdoors as it was a sunny day and really enjoyed the experience. Would recommend it if the weather permits. All in all, a great seafood place, but do be warned about the prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom

10CMAQGI_6p9ZQbsat6d2A.text: We've been here a few times and the food has been consistently superb!  The seafood is fresh tasting and delicious!On a recent dinner, we ordered the house platter and enjoyed every piece of morsel!  Even the ones we've never had before!  Then we were approached by a very nice gentleman and offered to share the scallop dish, fantastic!  And as it turns out, he is the owner and checking out the food and service!Thanks Ben!  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Delicious!

0K8LuhYvQfRCjoMklN8-Hw.text: The happy hour is actually quite nice. We ordered 30 oysters at £1 each. Very good value! The oysters are fresh and sweet. Just perfect for the happy hour.Everyday before 6pm. £1 oyster!As we ordered a bottle of Rosé, we wanted to try more food as we need to finish the bottle (well well well...)Then the reason of the 2 stars came up...One of their staff was VERY RUDE when taking orders. She's white, blonde with huge eyes, I don't know her name cause they don't wear name tags. She didn't even pay attention when I'm ordering, cause I'm only ordering one extra dish. Then, of course, the wrong thing came up and I told her colleagues. She was very rude and claimed that she did not make any mistake in taking the order loudly, and claimed that I gave the wrong order. Well. So. Why would I order something I don't even eat?She then came back to me and reconfirm the order twice, to be honest, I don't feel comfortable with her intonations and facial expressions, that seems like I blamed her of something I was wrong about, when she's the one making mistakes and paying attention during work.I seldom give out low grades but that's why I'm giving the low low low grade for this wonderful restaurant. I would love to give a 5 stars, but her staff really disappointed me so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. 30 oysters and 1 each!

YnZ-Eeg8oGtBbcFO9guX7Q.text: I used to love this place so much, I would travel here from Canary Wharf where I stayed for work once or twice a week to have a dinner. Then there was a 2 year gap in my travels, so you cannot imagine the excitement I had when I came back to London for a week. I circled around this place 3 times, but in the week between Christmas and New Year it was closed. So we decided to book a table for the actual New Years celebration dinner - the only time slot available was 22:30, so we took it. From the moment we got in everything went wrong. It took them about 15 minutes to find us a table and seat us and when the waitress came the first thing she said is that kitchen closes at 23:00. Quite a disappointment I must say, considering there was no warning when we made the reservation. When I looked at the menu I realized the raw seafood selection was cut in half, now featuring just some oysters, clams and shrimp - stuff you can get anywhere. The management or the chef must have changed, because the menu now is also not exciting. Nothing really to catch your eye. So we ordered a seafood platter which was ok. They were out of two dishes we picked as entrees so we settled on something else instead. Both were meh, lacking flavor or any interesting notes. My fiance's dish was overly greasy and bathed in some awful sauce. The restaurant was pretty empty by 23:30, so I asked if there was anything special for New Years and the answer was no. We asked for the check then trying to get out of the place - and it took our waitress half an hour to bring it! I had to re-ask twice, just to make sure we leave on time. Then we were just sitting there killing our time and I was ready to leave and come back to pay later, because the last thing I wanted is to celebrate inside of an empty restaurant. 5 minutes before midnight she finally re-appeared, but the night was ruined. We rushed to the street just to hear hurrays from every corner. On top of this unfortunate experience this was the most expensive dinner we had in London - quite a price for a below average food, slow impersonal service and an overall miserable night.

GjzOKq-mb-aASAIaU2RO9g.text: Been here a few times for happy hour and dinner and it's solid for seafood.  Happy hour oyster selections are pretty limited so don't expect too much there but £1/oyster is probably one of the best deals you can find in London and it's even available on the weekend.For dinner, I recommend the mussels dish.  It comes in a Thai curry sauce and is served with crusty bread on the side for dipping.  Be careful not to over order here because even the half portion is massive!

UoM1cc-5HWc91RBKs1ctIw.text: I came for a half dozen oysters at happy hour...Oyster happy hour is 3pm-6pm daily, oysters are £1 each. I sat outside facing the communal seating area inside Kingly Court. Oysters were tasty, but the abductor muscles had been left attached so some butchery was necessary to free the little buggers from their shells. Simple dressings of fresh lemon and mignonette were plentiful. House wine was crisp and quaffable, a perfect accompaniment to the oysters. Service was attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - Soho - London, United Kingdom. Oyster happy hour!

MGXS0uu99R8bI6Wv5uSGQg.text: This was a random find that was amazing. We ordered the oyster sampler and we were not disappointed. Each oyster was clean and had its own unique flavor. I would definitely try the Irish one!! We then continued to sample the menu and tried cockles, conch, and prawns. It was all delicious. The atmosphere was lovely, with the open space and lots of people watching. We will visit here every time we go to London.
